name: CreateableRemoteData
comment:
Represents data that is downloaded from a server, edited on the client, then
uploaded back to the server. It's really an extension of `EditableRemoteData`,
using a `Maybe data` to represent data that might or might not exist locally or
remotely.


# Types

@docs CreateableRemoteData


# Functions

@docs create, edit, set, delete, unwrapLocalRemote, unwrapLocal, maybeLocal, fromResult, upload, forceUpload, uploaded, isSaved, isLoading, isFailed, isSuccess, isUploading, isDeleted

aliases.name: CreateableRemoteData
aliases.comment:
Represents data that can be created, edited, and deleted on the client, then
uploaded to the server.

values.name: create
values.comment: Construct a new CreateableRemoteData that only exists locally
values.type: data -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue

values.name: delete
values.comment: Modify a CreateableRemoteData to show that the data no longer exists locally
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue

values.name: edit
values.comment: Modifies the local data if possible, otherwise does nothing
values.type: (data -> data) -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue

values.name: forceUpload
values.comment:
Very similar to `upload`, but will upload even if the remote has the same data
as the server.

*Note*: This will likely be removed in the future in favor of a way to modify
the remote's value. In other words, you'd mark the remote as deleted (`Nothing`)
the use a regular save.

If this is successful, the data is returned as a `Just LocalRemote`. Otherwise
`Nothing` is returned. It's up to your code to turn the `Just LocalRemote` into
a Cmd that sends the request to the server.
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> ( Maybe.Maybe (EditableRemoteData.LocalRemote (Maybe.Maybe data)) , CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue )

values.name: fromResult
values.comment:
Creates a CreateableRemoteData from a Result. Designed to be used to turn an
HTTP request result into CreateableRemoteData. The data in the Result is considered
syncronized, so the local and remote data is the same at this point.
values.type: Result.Result error data -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data error ue

values.name: isDeleted
values.comment: Check if a CreateableRemoteData is locally deleted
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> Bool

values.name: isFailed
values.comment: Check if a CreateableRemoteData has failed to download
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData date de uploadError -> Bool

values.name: isLoading
values.comment:
Check if a CreateableRemoteData is downloading. This will return `false` when
the data is being *uploaded*.
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData date de uploadError -> Bool

values.name: isSaved
values.comment: Check if a CreateableRemoteData has its local and remote data syncronized
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData date de uploadError -> Bool

values.name: isSuccess
values.comment: Check if a CreateableRemoteData has been successfully downloaded
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData date de uploadError -> Bool

values.name: isUploading
values.comment: Check if a CreateableRemoteData is currently uploading to sync its data
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData date de uploadError -> Bool

values.name: maybeLocal
values.comment:
Converts to a Just if the local data is availible, Nothing otherwise. This
makes it impossible to distingish between, say, deleted data and loading data.
So this should only be used in places where that won't matter.
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> Maybe.Maybe data

values.name: set
values.comment: Similar to `edit`, but it sets the data without caring about the previous value
values.type: data -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue

values.name: unwrapLocal
values.comment:
Runs a function on the local data inside a CreateableRemoteData if possible,
otherwise returns the default
values.type: a -> (Maybe.Maybe data -> a) -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> a

values.name: unwrapLocalRemote
values.comment:
Runs a function on the LocalRemote inside a CreateableRemoteData if possible,
otherwise returns the default
values.type: a -> (EditableRemoteData.LocalRemote (Maybe.Maybe data) -> a) -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> a

values.name: upload
values.comment:
Try to put the CreateableRemoteData into the "Uploading" state. This only works
if

  - The data has been successfully downloaded
  - The CreateableRemoteData isn't already uploading
  - The local and remote data is desyncronized

If this is successful, the data is returned as a `Just LocalRemote`. Otherwise
`Nothing` is returned. It's up to your code to turn the `Just LocalRemote` into
a Cmd that sends the request to the server.
values.type: CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue -> ( Maybe.Maybe (EditableRemoteData.LocalRemote (Maybe.Maybe data)) , CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de ue )

values.name: uploaded
values.comment:
Use this after an upload has completed. This will update the CreateableRemoteData
to refelect the result: either an error occured and the upload failed OR the data
was successfully saved and the remote value of the LocalRemote can be updated.

Note that edits can still be made while uploading, after the upload completes the
remote will be updated to refelect the data that was uploaded rather than the
current local data.
values.type: Result.Result uploadError () -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de uploadError -> CreateableRemoteData.CreateableRemoteData data de uploadError

name: EditableRemoteData

aliases.name: EditableRemoteData
aliases.comment:
Represents data that is downloaded from a server, edited on the client, then
uploaded back to the server.
aliases.type: RemoteData.RemoteData ( UploadStatus.UploadStatus data uploadError , EditableRemoteData.LocalRemote data ) downloadError

aliases.name: LocalRemote
aliases.comment:
Represents data that is on the client and server. This allows us to check if
the data needs to be synced.

values.name: edit
values.comment: Modifies the local data if possible, otherwise does nothing
values.type: (data -> data) -> EditableRemoteData.EditableRemoteData data de ue -> EditableRemoteData.EditableRemoteData data de ue

values.name: forceUpload
values.comment:
Very similar to `upload`, but will upload even if the remote has the same data
as the server.

*Note*: This will likely be removed in the future in favor of a way to modify
the remote's value. In other words, you'd mark the remote as deleted (`Nothing`)
the use a regular save.

If this is successful, the data is returned as a `Just LocalRemote`. Otherwise
`Nothing` is returned. It's up to your code to turn the `Just LocalRemote` into
a Cmd that sends the request to the server.
values.type: EditableRemoteData.EditableRemoteData data de ue -> ( Maybe.Maybe (EditableRemoteData.LocalRemote data) , EditableRemoteData.EditableRemoteData data de ue )

values.name: upload
values.comment:
Try to put the EditableRemoteData into the "Uploading" state. This only works
if

  - The data has been successfully downloaded
  - The EditableRemoteData isn't already uploading
  - The local and remote data is desyncronized

If this is successful, the data is returned as a `Just LocalRemote`. Otherwise

a Cmd that sends the request to the server.

values.comment:
Use this after an upload has completed. This will update the EditableRemoteData
to refelect the result: either an error occured and the upload failed OR the data
was successfully saved and the remote value of the LocalRemote can be updated.

Note that edits can still be made while uploading, after the upload completes the
remote will be updated to refelect the data that was uploaded rather than the
current local data.
values.type: Result.Result uploadError () -> EditableRemoteData.EditableRemoteData data de uploadError -> EditableRemoteData.EditableRemoteData data de uploadError

name: UploadStatus

types.name: UploadStatus
types.comment: Represents the three states of uploadable data

values.name: isUploading
values.comment: Check if the given UploadStatus is Uploading
values.type: UploadStatus.UploadStatus data error -> Bool

name: RemoteData

types.name: RemoteData
types.comment:
The basic RemoteData type. Represents data that can be downloaded from a
server. Note that unlike many representations, this version does not have a
`NotAsked` state.

values.name: fromResult
values.comment:
Create a RemoteData from a Result. Use this to turn an HTTP request result
into RemoteData.
values.type: Result.Result error data -> RemoteData.RemoteData data error

values.name: isFailed
values.comment: Check if a RemoteData has failed to download
values.type: RemoteData.RemoteData data error -> Bool

values.name: isLoading
values.comment:
Check if a RemoteData is downloading. This will return `false` when
the data is being *uploaded*.
values.type: RemoteData.RemoteData data error -> Bool

values.name: isSuccess
values.comment: Check if a RemoteData has been successfully downloaded
values.type: RemoteData.RemoteData data error -> Bool

values.name: map
values.comment: Modify the data inside if possible, otherwise do nothing
values.type: (data -> a) -> RemoteData.RemoteData data error -> RemoteData.RemoteData a error

values.name: toMaybe
values.comment: Convert the data to a Just, or a Nothing if the data isn't availible.
values.type: RemoteData.RemoteData data error -> Maybe.Maybe data

values.name: unwrap
values.comment: Run a function on the data if possible, otherwise returns the default
values.type: a -> (error -> a) -> (data -> a) -> RemoteData.RemoteData data error -> a
